page.title: 15PARK COTTAGE-'TWO CATS'
page.content: Park Cottage on Radcliffe Road is given the name 'Two Cats' because the Bradford coats of arms which are in the gables and bear the date 1854 have two leopards supporting them. The cottage is in the Gothic style and was originally built as a park keepers lodge. It has a steep roof which has fishtailed slates and it is the only relic which remains of Bolton's first park which was made by the Earl of Bradford and later closed by him. Fred Dibnah, the steeplejack now lives there, who is one of Bolton's most famous characters, both for his unusual job, and his hobby of restoring old steam engines and steam tractors in large sheds behind his house. He bought the property in 1967 for Â£5,000 and he has since built a rear extension.
